column2: Lots of geese. Water high. Lots of rain. Not clear. Mild wind.
Clear- the lake is like glass- warm day in the 80s and no wind.
Calm- cloudy lake and warm and humid.
Lots of rain. Fish jumping. 90 F.
Lake is like glass. 80 F. It has been very dry.
Big storm last night. Lots of rain. Heron out for fish. Mud washed into lake from const.
Rain last few days - sunshine - geese.
Coudy - storm on its way - wwater warm - several rain storms in area - turtles are back.
About 80 F - calm water - very brown - need rain.
rainy today- clear night- "new secchi" works well
Rain and more rain- can't paint the steps- walk the dog in the rain

column1: Flooding. No rain today. Lots of mud washed into lake
Starting to get back to normal
DNR here to take out carp.

column2: 70s Super day - Fall in the air
lake turned yesterday. lake turned yesterday. Cloudy- temperature in the 50's. Rain.
Cloudy. Lake calm. Heron here last night. Bass boats out.
4.5 inches of rain on June 18. Tons of mud and debris in the lake. Too bad people insist on digging up the hillside and banks.
Sun. 70-80 degrees. Calm and clear. Some algae floating.
Rain ever day for over a week - mud-like lake.
mild wind- mostly sunny- early ice off- abnormally high temperatures for season
warm (near 80 degrees)- bright- clear skies- water has waves from wind
bright- hot- water levels lower then normal- hasn't rained for weeks
Sunny clear calm and sunny normal water height
Algae on the surface- partly cloudy partly cloudy normal water height
Algae on surface- clear with slight breeze algae near shore clear breezy water level was low
Somewhat foggy foggy starting to clear low water level
70 F- partly cloudy- had rain in the morning
slight change of location- wind calm- 35 degrees- lake had iced over the previous night but had melted off
partly cloudy- 60 degrees- middle of lake
70 degrees- partly cldy- middle of lake
Heavy rain the day before. 76 degrees

column1: Did a secchi reading  7/19 at 10 inches- much reduced from 7/18
7/19 - received 4.2 inches of rain at night and the lake flooded approximately 3 feet higher than normal levels
Very warm and high humidity last 2 days
Will be reporting the color of the lake as brown under normal circumstances as opposed to the green which will indicate algae growth. This is a change.

column2: partly cloudy- rain yesterday- 72 degrees F
pt cloudy- 79 degrees F- lots of floating clumps of algae
been unseasonably warm has been unseasonably warm
Partly sunny- 58 degrees F- low wind- some water fowl  and bird activity - geese- merganser- eagles
Partly cloudy- warm and very windy with gusting
For some reason the original report was not saved and I am re-entrering information to the best of my recollection
I am reporting after the fact and retained only part of my report- the temps.

column1: I do not know why my June report was not saved and am reporting to the best of my recollection
only a sprinkle of rain in last 5 days

column2: Last 5 days without rain- before that 10 days of record setting rainfalls
Weather - Clear- 3days without rain...prior to that - 3 weeks with rain- many large rainfalls
Sunny day after plenty of rain in last month
much rain on and off last few days

column1: hot temp and humidities much rain on and off last few days

column2: A month of heavy rains and hot weather.

column1: Last week- the lake had visible algae forming around the edges and a somewhat oily surface. Secchi of 2.5
Heavy winds and rain have cleared the surface but created more turbulence.
clear last two days after week of rain
Since the start of the covid 19 restrictions- there has been an all-around increase in the use of the lake - fishing- boating- and swimming at the dam

column2: weather has been fair and hot
5 significant days of rain before yesterday
